alert.note: Alert for Orange; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 19 at 1:59PM EDT by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western Seminole, southeastern Lake and northwestern Orange Counties through 245 PM EDT... At 158 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from Mount Plymouth to Lake Mary. Movement was south at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Orlando, Deltona, Sanford, Apopka and Altamonte Springs. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or hard-topped vehicle. Remember, when thunder roars, go indoors! These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
